About This Game

Inspired by the popular comic book series produced by Top Cow Productions, Inc., The Darkness II is an intense first person shooter that delivers a twisted and gripping narrative of tragedy, modern crime drama, and supernatural horror.
Players will be taken down the brutal and personal path of Jackie Estacado, head of a New York crime family and wielder of an ancient and ruthless force of chaos and destruction known as The Darkness.
It’s been two years since Jackie Estacado used The Darkness to kill the men responsible for his girlfriend’s murder. He’s been unable to shake the memory of Jenny’s death since bottling up his supernatural power and now The Darkness wants out. A sudden, unprovoked attack by a mysterious organization known as the Brotherhood heralds the start of a full-scale war and opens the door for The Darkness to reemerge, setting Jackie on a journey to hell and worse.

Key Features

  • 4-Player Co-op Campaign - Play as one of four unique characters each capable of wielding weapons infused with Darkness powers.
  • Quad-Wielding Chaos - Slash, grab, and throw objects and enemies with the Demon Arms while simultaneously firing two weapons, adding a new dimension to the FPS category.
  • Harness an Unstoppable Power - Master the Demon Arms and summon the powers of The Darkness for even more explosive gameplay.
  • Kill the Lights - The vicious powers of The Darkness manifest only in the shadows so use the environment to your advantage and watch out for enemies who will use light as a weapon.
  • Intense and Personal Journey - Experience a dark, twisted and gripping story written exclusively for the game by acclaimed comic book author Paul Jenkins whose credits also include The Incredible Hulk, Wolverine, and the original The Darkness game.
  • Distinctive Graphic-Noir Style - Graphic novel shading and color combined with the dramatic lighting of film noir pays tribute to the source material and brings the pages of the comic series to life. Inspired by the popular comic book series created by Top Cow.

    Limited Edition Content

    If you pre-purchased The Darkness II you are exclusively entitled to the Limited Edition, which includes free digital editions of The Darkness: Origins Volumes 1 and 2, collecting the origin of Jackie Estacado and the Darkness by Garth Ennis and Marc Silvestri!

    Please visit http://comics.comixology.com/redeem and enter your code. You must login to your comiXology account, or create one, in order to redeem. Once redeemed, you can download your comics on your smartphone or tablet device, as well as read on the web!

System Requirements

Mac OS X
    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP/Vista/7
    • Processor: Intel Core 2 @ 2GHz / AMD Athlon 64 X2 4200+
    • Memory: 1.5GB RAM
    • Hard Disk Space: 10GB
    • Video Card: 256MB NVIDIA GeForce 8600 / ATI Radeon HD 2600
    • Sound: DirectX Compatible

72 of 77 people (94%) found this review helpful

1 person found this review funny
Murphy's Lawyer
727 products in account
96 reviews
Recommended
24.4 hrs on record
Posted: August 1
The Darkness II is an action FPS with strong narrative elements and a stylish, graphic-noir atmosphere. The gameplay feels both familiar and fresh simultaneously, while the characters and story keep the player engaged and interested. Also, the addition of an XP system and skill-trees allow the player to continue to work towards new goals and to customize their character according to their preferred combat style. All of these elements mesh together to create a very enjoyable game that I feel all but the most extremely discerning gamers should appreciate.

One of the most intriguing aspects of The Darkness II is the story, and the characters that make it. The twisted and confused thoughts of the main character set the tone of the game from the first level, and evolve as the story progresses, in a similar fashion to games like Max Payne and Alan Wake . The auxiliary characters are diverse and interesting, enticing the player to initiate optional conversations. The narrative is a perfect blend of mafia drama and psychological thriller that should enthrall anyone who enjoys being told a good story.

The actual gameplay experience is also exquisite. The combination of familiar FPS aspects with some well-integrated novelty goes a long way to make the game downright fun . There are various guns and abilities to use to wreak havoc on your enemies during action-packed fight sequences. Additionally, the XP and skill-point system will keep you goal-oriented and allow you to unlock new abilities as you play to keep things fresh.

For those itching for more after beating the main campaign, there is also an entirely separate Co-op Mode, which expands upon the universe of The Darkness II and allows for multiplayer gameplay. Fortunately, all the missions in the Co-op Mode can be completed in solo play if you don’t want to spend time trying to find others to play with. While not quite as pristine as the main campaign, it adequately provides some supplementary gameplay to a game that would otherwise be only medium-length (in terms of total hours).

In summary, I posit that The Darkness II is a superb all-around game with many positive elements contributing to its overall quality. I would say it is a pretty safe bet for most gamers who have a broad taste for games, and a definite safe bet for those gamers who enjoy FPS games and interesting narratives. Expect about 15-25 hours of gameplay, depending on how much of a “completionist” you are. If you can get it for a price you are comfortable with, it is definitely worth the pick-up.

Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations!

The Darkness II is fun and satisfying because of its unique gameplay that lets you use demonic powers to fight with 4 arms (2 human arms & 2 demon arms). The story and graphics are good too which help compliment the awesome gameplay. Co-op mode has it's own interesting story that's related to the main game's story and it's playable solo if you don't have any friends.

The Darkness II pretty good game...

Gameplay:
A good selection of weapons, possibly interaction of with the surrounding objects, great choice of leveling skills. This game have co-op, but I don't try it. Don't think I can got fun on this game with friends...

Graphics:
Looks not bad, but my eyes get tired from this graphic. Graphic style close to Borderlands.

Story:
This game got not big short story with few the ends. In this game no matter what ending you choose, I seelct second ending, it's give achievement and little more story & gameplay (I played 7.4 hours).

Price:
I think 29,99€ for this short game to much... It makes sense to buy the game on sale.

Another great game, with twisted Gameplay.
In the name of Darkness you kill people with your tentacles, slicing people into pieces and ripping them apart.

The Storyline is a nice one, but if it bores you, then you can simply skip the cinametics and conversations.
Always a great future that not every game has.

Had allot of fun playing it, but I did find the campaign short ( lasted only 5 hours ).
Good thing they got Vendetta mode which adds what I was looking for those missions are great.

My favorite moments is actually when you get to play as the lil demon monkey.
Can't wait ( hopefully ) for Darkness III

Pakkidis
884 products in account
129 reviews
Recommended
12.3 hrs on record
Posted: September 23
The Darkness 2
Rating 8/10
Overview: Underrated First Person Shooter

The Good:

+ Cell shaded graphics

+ The game has a strong narrative which holds the game together otherwise it would turn into a mindless shooter. Although the plot itself is pretty basic the developers did a great job of presenting the story. The characters may be stereotypical of what you would expect in a mafia however it doesn't take away the fact they are believable and expertly voiced.

+ The game features a variety of guns which is what you would expect from any first person shooter however the twist in this game is that you have two demonic arms, one for picking/throwing objects and the other as a high powered melee weapon. You can also execute enemies in some pretty horrific ways.

+ Speaking of gratuitous violence, it works well in this game. Most games have over the top violence just for the sake of it yet I feel this game really nailed this particular aspect, it really sells the notion that you are possessed by dark forces.

+ Killing enemies and collecting relics in the levels allows you to level up different skills among 4 skill trees.

+ New Game + allows you to replay the game with all your acquired skills

+ Easy Achievements, minimal grinding required.

+ Great voice acting

+ Good soundtrack


The Average:

On the one hand the game is short, roughly 5-7 hours in length. On the other hand the game isn't bogged down with pointless filler either, the game does what it wants to without over extending its welcome.

After you complete the main story, you can try the vendetta campaign, an add on to extend your playtime. You can choose between 4 characters, each with their own weapon, skill trees and powers. You can also play co-op with friends. The problem however is that every level becomes very repetitive of killing wave after wave of enemy. The formula wears itself out very early on. This mode is also very short , roughly 2-3 hours in length.

The Bad:

- Multiplayer is dead



Conclusion

It was a sequel that didn't need to be made but in the end it turned out to be a great game to a very underappreciated game franchise. A fun distraction while it lasts and nothing more. Strongly recommend at a discount price.
